item.title: Hereditary brAhmaNa priests
item.description: There is some deal of fluidity in varNa in contrast to jAti but brAhmaNa varNa was not fluid to same degree. Given the responsibility, it’s natural that the level scrutiny before one can be a brahman will be greater. It’s just about merit, or more? There is absolutely no escaping the hereditary component as far as “brAhmaNa” is concerned…There is a finite number of gotras from which a brAhmaNa must have obtained patrilineal descent (svIkAra, adoption arrangements) between gotras were accepted. The old texts do emphasize the ARSeya (Of/from a RSi) root of a brAhmaNa - there is no denying this. Having clarified that, let me continue.
